page.title: 10Traditions in Elton village
page.content: Traditionlly May Day is celebrated on May 1st but at school we choose any day early in the month.Out comes the wooden Maypole on its stand,and we dance around it to music.Ribbons attached to the pole twirl into patterns as the children dance"Spiders Web","Barbers Pole"and Plaiting.On Nov 5th we have Bonfire Night.There is a huge pile of wood on the field by the mill,with a dummy on top to represent Guy Fawkes who attempted unsuccessfully to blow up Parliament long ago.Bright fireworks fly into the sky and there is food and drink for sale. A new tradition has started of having a children's party in the Highgate Hall soon after Christmas.There are games and a buffet meal and finally a magician.
